TopicTitle: Top Gun AI - The Official Tournament Thread

Articles.Content:
Hey, nice thread!

I cant host a tourney this Sunday, but I should be able to later in the week. It sounds like PixelStory might host this time, so that will be good.

I'd also like to add my vote for adding Quiztech, I've played around with it and none of the engines seem OP, and the rest of the parts are pretty much just for looks.

B9 wings are OP. They add like 4 times more lift than the same shaped stock wing. 

Pwings was recently updated, but I havent tested it for balance:

[http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/130196-1-0-4-Procedural-Dynamics-Procedural-Wing-v0-10-0-30-July](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/130196-1-0-4-Procedural-Dynamics-Procedural-Wing-v0-10-0-30-July)

Here is the latest version of the Goblin if someone decides to run a tourney before I get a chance to check back:

[http://pastebin.com/ZqeYn6Xd](http://pastebin.com/ZqeYn6Xd)
Well, this computer will not cooperate with Kerbal Konstrcuts so... To my other computer!

If only it used FAR... I could design a stock part aircraft that could fly and fight in FAR..... but stocks notquiteNEARlytheresouposphere just is a no-go for me. 

I am interested in seeing the videos of some of these fights though.

Have you tried the stock aero since 1.0? its nothing like it used to be. 

FAR is too much simulation for me. I get bored spending 30 minutes moving around radially attached nosecones to get a better drag profile.

> 
> Hey, nice thread!
> I cant host a tourney this Sunday, but I should be able to later in the week. It sounds like PixelStory might host this time, so that will be good.
> 
> I'd also like to add my vote for adding Quiztech, I've played around with it and none of the engines seem OP, and the rest of the parts are pretty much just for looks.
> 
> B9 wings are OP. They add like 4 times more lift than the same shaped stock wing. 
> 
> Pwings was recently updated, but I havent tested it for balance:
> 
> [http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/130196-1-0-4-Procedural-Dynamics-Procedural-Wing-v0-10-0-30-July](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/130196-1-0-4-Procedural-Dynamics-Procedural-Wing-v0-10-0-30-July)

> [http://pastebin.com/ZqeYn6Xd](http://pastebin.com/ZqeYn6Xd)

Okay. What do you think? Should I make Quiztech allowed by default, or make it vary by tournament?

> 
> If only it used FAR... I could design a stock part aircraft that could fly and fight in FAR..... but stocks notquiteNEARlytheresouposphere just is a no-go for me. 
> I am interested in seeing the videos of some of these fights though.

Searching #topgunai will present you with a lot of mesmerizing videos.

**THE 1ST ANNUAL PIXEL TOURNAMENT**

**BD Armory + Stock PVP**

**Welcome to the first "Pixel Tournament"!**

**This is a Stock/BD Armory tournament for NEW planes in 1.0.4.**

**Rules:**

**No copying other peoples planes**

**Plane must stay in air once the match has started**

**Don't be a poor sport**

**Have fun!**

**Requirements:**

**Must be under the 60 point limit**

**Must be under 30 tons**

**Must be at least 5 tons**

**The tournament will start Monday at 10:00 AM EST**

**so get your entries in now!**

**Bracket:**

[http://challonge.com/PixelTourney1](http://challonge.com/PixelTourney1)

**Entries:**

**Im The One :** **SUBAT-2MK1**

**EvenFlow : XMF-1B**

**FlipNascar : Budgie**

**RocketTurtle : Blizzard II**

**SuicidalInsanity : Fighter Pod Mk.1**

**t3hJimmer : The Hobgoblin**

**Slam\_Jones :** **Slamtek Falcon 1-A**

**Zixor : Air Fram 82-99**

**Alphasus : F-25 Peregrine**

**Video:**

Round 1

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/PqTtP6U45Ws?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

**Notes:**

**Previous posts said that there would be an a custom arena,**

 **this is not true as creating arenas are to glitchy at the moment.**

**If anyone would like to try making an arena, the best places to make them**

**are at the polar ice caps.**

**Edited <time datetime="2015-08-03T15:34:36Z" title="08/03/2015 03:34  PM" data-short="8 yr">August 3, 2015</time> by PixelStory**

6 x aim9x sidewinders(4pts)=24 points

2 x hidden 20mm vulcan(9pts)=18 points

2 x Ammo Cans(4pts)=8 points

2 x countermeasure pods(5pts)=10 points

Sign me up. Fighter Pod mk1: [http://kerbalx.com/SuicidalInsanity/Fighter-Pod.craft](http://kerbalx.com/SuicidalInsanity/Fighter-Pod.craft)

Armament: 

6x Sidewinder, (24 points)

 2x .50 turrets fixed forward, (8 points)

2 ammo cans, (8 points)

4 CM pods, (20 points)

60 points total

Damn, only 7.9 tons. I'm a bit scared...

Edit: oh only one engine. Okay, that makes more sense.

Too bad I'm not at home, can't send in my fighter.

Example from the WW2 topic:

![7hqgfCr.png](http://i.imgur.com/7hqgfCr.png)

Never said it didn't. I was just impressed, because I thought you made a 2 engine fighter that was only 7.9 tons

Ok I will need to edit my submission here when I get back from the store, totally forgot to set the AI settings for flight cause the default settings don't let it turn as sharp as it can (and I just remembered a design flaw in it from earlier)

> 
> Ok I will need to edit my submission here when I get back from the store, totally forgot to set the AI settings for flight cause the default settings don't let it turn as sharp as it can (and I just remembered a design flaw in it from earlier)

That's fine. As long as you have it in before Pixel hosts the tournament.
What's the policy on rocket pods like the Hydra? Okay or not okay?

> 
> What's the policy on rocket pods like the Hydra? Okay or not okay?

I guess I didn't include that. Hm... I've never actually used them. Are they any good for air to air combat? I would assume the AI can lead with them decently.

Re:rocket pods - Edit: just tried them again just now and I cant get the AI to use them. So I guess no on the rocket pods?

Here is my official Pixel Tournament submission. The final evolution of the Goblin series, **The Hobgoblin**.

![lQdC5iG.png](http://i.imgur.com/lQdC5iG.png)

**Hobgoblin Specs:**

Parts: 61

Mass: 13.6 t at take off (9.9 t empty)

Length: 10 m

Wingspan:10.1 m

**Armaments:**

GAU-8 X1 (11 points)

30mm Ammo X1 (4 points)

Sidewinder X6 (24 points)

Cm pod X4 (20 points)

59 points total

Craft File here: [http://pastebin.com/aNc5wiur](http://pastebin.com/aNc5wiur)
